timeline.bodyText: Check style will complain in Java, variables should be Lower camel case
timeline.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText:
I think I misunderstood how the Github review function work, the changes are in a later commit. I'll add <module name="LocalVariableName"/> which should detects invalid local variable names to my checkstyle.xml and hopefully no one will have to comment on it again :P
Thank you for taking the time to look through it and answer my questions!
replies.author: k3KAW8Pnf7mkmdSMPHz27

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand if there is an advantage of making the key public static final rather than  private final as it is used for both equals and hashcode? Setting the KEY = "truncate" + truncateIndex as it is already handled as a separate case in Formatters.getFormatterForModifier(commented above).
timeline.author: k3KAW8Pnf7mkmdSMPHz27

replies.bodyText:
It should be private. If it's not used outside the class.
Private final static is a compile constant. The compiler replaces all occurrences of the constant with its value.
And you already have a getter for access for better
https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/encapsulation-in-java/
replies.author: Siedlerchr

timeline.bodyText: Special check because it requires numeric input.
timeline.author: k3KAW8Pnf7mkmdSMPHz27

replies.bodyText:
I think it would also make sense to extract this to a Pattern and call compile on it
https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/pattern-compilestring-method-in-java-with-examples/
replies.author: Siedlerchr

timeline.bodyText:
Note that on my system the maximum filename and directory name is 255 characters long while the absolute pathname appears to be limited to 1024 characters on FAT32.
Windows appear to have a default maximum path length of 260 which I'd consider an argument for not including these lines.
timeline.author: k3KAW8Pnf7mkmdSMPHz27

replies.bodyText:
Java will throw an IO exception error if it's not possible, so we should not modify the (generated directory structure), just the filename.  Your bib file or file directory could also be on an network drive and that length limit does not apply to those,...
=>So remove these lines.
replies.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: Won't it throw the same exception for an invalid filename? -> remove the check for filename length?
replies.author: k3KAW8Pnf7mkmdSMPHz27

replies.bodyText: Sure, but filenames are a bit different, as they are usually auto generated from a download. If you have a paper with a long title and some other maybe illegal characters, you don't want to fix it manually. That's why we only care for filenames.
replies.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: Ok. The lines are removed! As always, thank you for taking the time to look through and answer questions!
replies.author: k3KAW8Pnf7mkmdSMPHz27
